events.title: Sha Jingtang Elected as Prime Minister of Ming Dynasty
events.description: Sha Jingtang becomes the Prime Minister of the Ming Dynasty in China, influencing political decisions during the period.
events.significance: Marked a significant leadership change affecting Ming Dynasty governance.

events.title: California Gold Rush Begins
events.description: James W. Marshall discovers gold at Sutter's Mill in California, sparking the California Gold Rush.
events.significance: Triggered massive migration to California, accelerating its admission to the United States and pioneering economic development.

events.title: The First X-ray Image in the United States
events.description: Gustav Bucky takes the first X-ray image in the U.S., advancing medical imaging technology.
events.significance: Enhanced diagnostic capabilities in medicine, laying groundwork for modern radiology.

events.title: Four African American Students Begin Sit-in at Greensboro Woolworth's
events.description: Four African American students start a sit-in protest at a segregated Woolworth's lunch counter in Greensboro, North Carolina.
events.significance: Ignited similar protests across the U.S., becoming a pivotal moment in the fight against racial segregation.

events.title: YouTube Founded
events.description: YouTube, the global online video-sharing platform, is founded by Steve Chen, Chad Hurley, and Jawed Karim.
events.significance: Revolutionized video sharing and internet media, impacting entertainment, education, and communication worldwide.
